markdown:
'''{{Pagename nd}}''' is a {{lc:Document }} in {{poe2}}.

##  Description 

'''Kill Kolsc (in [Lord of a Barren Land](/lordOfABarrenLand/)):'''
{{Description |{{#var:description}}}}
'''Kill Raedric only once (in [Lord of a Barren Land](/lordOfABarrenLand/)):'''
{{Description|The seal upon this letter bears the tree and wheat sheaves associated with the Raedric line.

"To the Watcher of Caed Nua,

Five years I have waited, while you flout my challenge, content to hide within your fortress at Caed Nua.

Then, my servants told me that your keep had been destroyed. I despaired of having my revenge. 

But Berath has plucked you from that distant shore. What better sign is there, to say that we are fated to battle one another?"

The letter goes on like this for some time. It is signed, "Lord Raedric VII, Thayn of Gilded Vale, Champion of Berath"}}

##  Acquisition 

{{#arraymap: {{#var:location}}|;|x|x|\n}}
raw:
{{Infobox item poe2
| name           = Letter from Raedric VII
| icon           = poe2 rolled_letter icon.png
| description    = The seal upon this letter bears the tree and sheaves of wheat associated with the Raedric line.

"To the Watcher of Caed Nua,

I am told your people found you alive, in a state not unlike that suffered by those under the Hollowborn curse. 

I would they had brought you here, where the priests could have seen to you. 
Still, I know that you are in Berath's hands. Who but they could have plucked you from the Shattered God's grasp? 

You have worked Berath's will in the past, and if that same will sends you to the far side of the sea, I trust you will fulfill your charge. 

I await your return. For years you and I have guided the people of Yenwood. There is still much work to be done.

Lord Raedric VII, Thayn of Gilded Vale"
| added_in       = poe2
| equipment_slot = Unequippable
| item_type      = Document
| item_category  = Other item
| requirements   = 
| is_soulbound   = no
| is_unique      = no

"To the Watcher of Caed Nua,

Five years I have waited, while you flout my challenge, content to hide within your fortress at Caed Nua.

Then, my servants told me that your keep had been destroyed. I despaired of having my revenge. 

But Berath has plucked you from that distant shore. What better sign is there, to say that we are fated to battle one another?"

The letter goes on like this for some time. It is signed, "Lord Raedric VII, Thayn of Gilded Vale, Champion of Berath"}}
